text: energy efficiency resource standard rulemaking within days of the effective date of this section the commission shall initiate a proceeding to develop rules to implement the energy efficiency resource standard eers such rules shall be adopted and effective not later than july each plan for the eers shall require legislative approval based on a demonstration of cost effectiveness consistent with the legislative mandate that the commission prioritize energy efficiency and supply resources in order to provide the lowest reasonable cost energy supply to customers as well as the requirement to set just and reasonable rates the rules shall establish savings targets with a goal of all achievable and provable energy efficiency within the context of available sustainable funding use at least a planning period consider rate impacts on customers in setting goals focus primarily on comprehensive electric and gas programs with secondary focus on fuel neutral programs continue joint coordination of programs by the electric and gas utilities drive innovation in technology outreach and regulation to accelerate energy efficiency gains provide robust evaluation measurement and verification comprised of data collection monitoring and analysis associated with the calculation of savings from individual projects to ensure that the program meets its savings targets and spends ratepayer funds in a just and reasonable manner and that energy efficiency programs are cost effective leverage the private financing market and increase public awareness of the benefits of energy efficiency fund the eers with the systems benefits charge and the local distribution adjustment charge provide a to percent performance incentive for utilities allow utilities to recover just reasonable and prudent costs incurred in developing promoting and delivering the eers programs require a suspension of any scheduled or pending plan when a state of emergency has been declared by the governor in such case the previously approved plan will remain in place restructuring policy principles system benefits charge amend rsa vi to read as follows benefits for all consumers restructuring of the electric utility industry should be implemented in a manner that benefits all consumers equitably and does not benefit one customer class to the detriment of another costs should not be shifted unfairly among customers system benefits charge a a nonbypassable and competitively neutral system benefits charge applied to the use of the distribution system may shall be used only to fund public benefits related to the provision of electricity such benefits this charge as approved by regulators the general court may include but not necessarily be limited to fund programs for customers energy efficiency programs the electricity utility industry s portion of the energy efficiency resource standard described in rsa funding for the electric utility industry s share of commission expenses pursuant to rsa support for research and development and investments in commercialization strategies for new and beneficial technologies b legislative approval of the new hampshire general court shall be required to increase the system benefits charge and to enumerate its uses this requirement of prior approval of the new hampshire general court shall not apply to the energy efficiency portion of the system benefits charge if the increase is authorized by an order of the commission to implement the planning periods of the energy efficiency resource standard framework established by commission order no dated august ending in and or if for purposes other than implementing the energy efficiency resource standard is authorized by the fiscal committee of the general court provided however that such approval for the energy efficiency portion of the system benefits charge can be provided by the approval of a eers plan as described in rsa to ameliorate economic uncertainty any scheduled or pending increase in the systems benefits charge shall be suspended during a declared state of emergency no less than percent of the portion of the funds collected for energy efficiency shall be expended on electric energy efficiency programs energy efficiency programs should include the development of relationships with lending institutions to provide opportunities for financing of energy efficiency measures to leverage available funds to the maximum extent and shall also include funding for workforce development to minimize waiting periods for energy audits and weatherization
